docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate prepared today to take up legislation that would give President Bush added power to negotiate trade deals, with passage complicated by a partisan dispute over how to help workers who lose their jobs to international competition. The bill, a version of which passed in the House last year by a one-vote margin, is one of the White House's top legislative priorities. It would clear the way for new trade negotiations by giving the president the right to make deals that would be subject to ratification by Congress but not to any amendments.

headline.main: Partisan Fight On Job Losses Casts Shadow On Trade Bill

docs.abstract: Senate prepares to take up legislation that would give Pres Bush added power to negotiate trade deals, with passage complicated by partisan dispute over how to help workers who lose their jobs to international competition (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Harry and Louise, the fictional couple who helped doom President Bill Clinton's health care plan, are back at their kitchen table. But this time they are arguing for cloning for research, and they are already competing for airtime with new opponents: Harriet and Louis, who oppose cloning for any purpose.

headline.main: 'Harry and Louise' Battle 'Harriet and Louis' in Ad Debate Over Cloning Research

docs.abstract: Harry and Louise, fictional couple used in teleivision ads for Pres Bill Clinton's health care plan, reappear in ads promoting human cloning for research purposes; new campaign is commissioned by nonprofit group Cures Now; competing radio campaign commissioned by Stop Human Cloning features characters Harriet and Louis; Senate is set to take up bill this month that would ban all forms of cloning; photo (M)
